fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.items

Class ItemUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zcraft.quartzlib.tools.items.ItemUtils

  • public abstract class ItemUtils
extends Object
    Utility class for dealing with items and inventories.

    • Method Detail

      • consumeItem

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack consumeItem(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Simulates the player consuming the itemstack in its hand, depending on his game mode. This decreases the ItemStack's size by one, and replaces it with air if nothing is left.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that will consume the stack.
        Returns:
        The updated stack.

      • consumeItem

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack consumeItem(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                                         org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Simulates the player consuming the given itemstack, depending on his game mode. This decreases the ItemStack's size by one, and replaces it with air if nothing is left.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that will consume the stack.
        item - The stack to be consumed.
        Returns:
        The updated stack.

      • give

        public static boolean give(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                           org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Emulates the behaviour of the /give command.
        Parameters:
        player - The player to give the item to.
        item - The item to give to the player
        Returns:
        true if the player received the item in its inventory, false if it had to be totally or partially dropped on the ground.

      • setDisplayName

        public static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack setDisplayName(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item,
                                                            String displayName)
        Shortcut method to set the display name of an item.
        Parameters:
        item - The item
        displayName - The new display name of the item
        Returns:
        The same item.

      • areSimilar

        public static boolean areSimilar(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack first,
                                 org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack other)
        Checks if two item stacks are similar, by checking the type, data and display name (if set).
        Parameters:
        first - An item stack. Can be null.
        other - Another item stack. Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if similar (either both null or similar).

      • hasDisplayName

        public static boolean hasDisplayName(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack,
                                     String displayName)
        Checks if an item stack have the given display name.
        Parameters:
        stack - An item stack. Can be null.
        displayName - A display name.
        Returns:
        true if the item stack have the given display name.

      • damageItemInHand

        public static void damageItemInHand(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                    org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item,
                                    int factor)
        Emulates the item in the player loosing durability as if the given player was using it. If the player is in creative mode, the item won't be damaged at all. The Unbreaking enchantments are taken into account. The player's inventory is also updated, if needed.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that is using the item.
        item - The item in the player's hand.
        factor - The amount of damage taken.

      • breakItemInHand

        public static void breakItemInHand(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                   DualWielding hand)
        Breaks the item currently in the hand of the player.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        hand - The hand to retrieve the item from. This will always be the main hand if the Bukkit build don't support dual-wielding.

      • breakItemInHand

        public static void breakItemInHand(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                   org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Breaks the given item if it is found in one of the player's hands.
        Parameters:
        player - The player.
        item - The item to break.

      • getMinecraftId

        public static String getMinecraftId(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
                             throws NMSException
        Returns the Minecraft internal ID of an ItemStack.

        As example, the ID of a Material.STONE item is minecraft.stone. This ID is needed to include items in JSON-formatted messages.

        Parameters:
        item - An item.
        Returns:
        The Minecraft name of this item, or null if the item's material is invalid.
        Throws:
        NMSException - if the operation cannot be executed.

      • getI18nName

        public static String getI18nName(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
                          throws NMSException
        Retrieves the key to use in the translate property of a JSON message to translate the name of the given ItemStack.
        Parameters:
        item - An item.
        Returns:
        The I18N key for this item.
        Throws:
        NMSException - if the operation cannot be executed.

      • asNMSCopy

        public static Object asNMSCopy(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
                        throws NMSException
        Copies the ItemStack in a new net.minecraft.server.ItemStack.
        Parameters:
        item - An item.
        Returns:
        A copy of this item as a net.minecraft.server.ItemStack object.
        Throws:
        NMSException - if the operation cannot be executed.

      • asCraftCopy

        public static Object asCraftCopy(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
                          throws NMSException
        Copies the ItemStack in a new CraftItemStack.
        Parameters:
        item - An item.
        Returns:
        A copy of this item in a CraftItemStack object.
        Throws:
        NMSException - if the operation cannot be executed.

      • getNMSItemStack

        public static Object getNMSItemStack(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
                              throws NMSException
        Returns a NMS ItemStack for the given item.
        Parameters:
        item - An item.
        Returns:
        A NMS ItemStack for this item. If the item was a CraftItemStack, this will be the item's handle directly; in the other cases, a copy in a NMS ItemStack object.
        Throws:
        NMSException - if the operation cannot be executed.

      • getCraftItemStack

        public static Object getCraftItemStack(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
                                throws NMSException
        Returns a CraftItemStack for the given item.
        Parameters:
        item - An item.
        Returns:
        A CraftItemStack for this item. If the item was initially a CraftItemStack, it is returned directly. In the other cases, a copy in a new CraftItemStack will be returned.
        Throws:
        NMSException - if the operation cannot be executed.

      • asDye

        @Contract(pure=true)
public static Optional<org.bukkit.DyeColor> asDye(@Nullable
                                                                       @Nullable org.bukkit.ChatColor color)
        Converts a chat color to its dye equivalent.

        The transformation is not perfect as there is no 1:1 correspondence between dyes and chat colors.

        Parameters:
        color - The chat color.
        Returns:
        The corresponding dye, or an empty value if none match (e.g. for formatting codes, of for null).

      • colorize

        @Contract(pure=true)
public static org.bukkit.Material colorize(@NotNull
                                                                @NotNull ColorableMaterial material,
                                                                @NotNull
                                                                @NotNull org.bukkit.DyeColor color)
        Converts a dye color to a dyeable material.
        Parameters:
        material - The colorable material to colorize.
        color - The dye color.
        Returns:
        The corresponding material.

      • colorize

        @Contract(pure=true)
public static org.bukkit.Material colorize(@NotNull
                                                                @NotNull ColorableMaterial material,
                                                                @NotNull
                                                                @NotNull org.bukkit.ChatColor color)
        Converts a chat color to a dyeable material.
        Parameters:
        material - The colorable material to colorize.
        color - The chat color.
        Returns:
        The corresponding material. If the chat color was not convertible to a dye, ChatColor#WHITE is used.
